title: Will filing for bankruptcy hurt my child custody court case?
question: If I were to file for bankruptcy, will it have a negative impact on my child custody case?
question_tags: Child custody,Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy petition,Bankruptcy documents,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Family law
answers:
No. In fact, it could actually help.
I'll be receiving a discharge, your honor, of all of my debts; so I will be able to commit more of my income to the benefit of my child(ren) when they are with me.

I don't know family law but I do agree with my colleague.

There is an argument that can be made, which is that you are not responsible with money and had to file for bankruptcy. However, there is a stronger argument (in my opinion) that you have now switched gears and are headed in the right direction, free of debt.

Best to talk with an experienced bk attorney that can look at your whole situation!

I don't know California law but I do not see how bankruptcy would affect the best interest of the children. especially if it is filed in good faith and resolves your financial issues. Discharging debt and restructuring your finances would most likely make your home life more stable for the child(ren).
